column4: how do i determine what module is running the bluetooth in my laptop? I want to disable it so as not to consume so much battery power
just disable bluetooth from startup programs
will that actually disable the device, or just the applet for the taskbar?
it will cause bluetooth to not startup on boot
thank you. Do you think I will see any significant change in battery use?
!bluetooth
it depends, bluetooth is a low-power protocol so probably not by much
you're probably better off just lowering your LCD brightness until you cant see the screen any more =)
got it lowered now. Does disabling desktop efects make a diff?
I think it may be this damn AMD Turion X2 64 cpu. Fan never stops running..It does stay cool though
well sure, anythign that causes your cpu to be used less will save you battery life
the big killers are the LCD screen and the programs you run
running it at 800MHz doesnt seem to change it. I think this laptop performs about the same running Windows. I guess its just a power hungry laptop. HP dv2310us
perhaps my solution is just to buy a 12 cell battery
the battery could just be dying
you would probably be better off, and get more functionality out of your laptop
its relatively new, about a year old. I got it used yesterday and repaired it
nice laptop, just the battery life sucks
my girlfriends laptop ate 3 batteries in her first two years of owning it. Those HPs get so damn hot
heat is another real killer of battery life
I thought about a laptop chill pad, but that would just eat more battery to power it
I thought about buy a laptop cooler, but that would just eat more battery to power it through the USB bus
